uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.jdbc.filter

Interface JoinFilter<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - type of object selected
    All Superinterfaces:
    BaseFilter<T>, BaseSQLFilter<T>, PatternFilter<T>, Targetted<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AndFilter, AppUserFactory.RoleFilter, BaseCombineFilter, BaseSQLCombineFilter, ConstJoinerFilter, DataObjectFactory.DestFilter, DataObjectFactory.RemoteFilter, HistoryFactory.HistoryFilter, IndexedLinkManager.LinkFilter, IndexedLinkManager.SQLLinkFilter, Joiner, JoinerFilter, LinkHistorySQLFilter, LogFactory.DateFilter, LogFactory.ItemDateFilter, LogFactory.TypeFilter, SQLAndFilter, SQLFormFilter, SQLOrFilter, TupleFactory.TupleAndFilter, WildCardReferenceFilter, WtmpManager.DateFilter

    public interface JoinFilter<T>
extends PatternFilter<T>
    Interface for filters that add an explicit join clause. The intention here is to filter entries from the primary tables based on the data it points to The filter clauses on the remote object have to be done entirely in SQL because we are only returning objects from the primary table. Any condition clause will need to qualify the field names This is added in to the source clause by the FilterReader.
    Author:
    spb
